text: Denmark competed at the 2015 World Aquatics Championships in Kazan, Russia from 24 July to 9 August 2015. ==Medalists== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="font-size:90%" |- ! Medal ! Name ! Sport ! Event ! Date |- | || || Swimming || Women's 100 m butterfly || |- | || || Swimming || Women's 50 m butterfly || |- | || || Swimming || Women's 100 m backstroke || |- | || || Swimming || Women's 200 m breaststroke || |} ==Swimming== Danish swimmers have achieved qualifying standards in the following events (up to a maximum of 2 swimmers in each event at the A-standard entry time, and 1 at the B-standard): Eleven of these swimmers have been nominated to compete for Denmark at the World Championships, including current world record holder Rikke Møller Pedersen in the 200 m breaststroke, 2008 Olympic bronze medalist Lotte Friis in long-distance freestyle, and three-time Olympian and defending World champion Jeanette Ottesen in the 50 m butterfly. ;Men {|class=wikitable
